Body: I tried to install library ESP8266WebServer into platformio IDE. I got this error functional: No such file or directory". A bit of research of "functional"
column9:
http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/functional/

In file included from configMode.cpp:13:0:	.pioenvs/uno/ESP8266WebServer/ESP8266WebServer.h:27:22: fatal error: functional: No such file or directory	#include <functional>	^	compilation terminated.
"

Body: Is there any progress in solution this problem ?
Check the include path that the compiler is using.
I think I use vim instead at the end.
I'm getting the same error, with the same class on https://create.arduino.cc/editor

The name of library i most cases should start with upper case character and ends .h .

In this case I guess that it looks like this:

#include <Functional.h>
That is true for C but not C++. The include file is a standard, see http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/header/functional
